definition: to disturb/to cause a commotion/to harass
trouble/disturbance/rumpus/flirty/coquettish/abbr. for 離騷|离骚[Li2 Sao1]/literary writings/smell of urine/foul smell/male (animal) (dialect)

sentences.english: I was sexually accosted on the train.
sentences.chinese: 我在火车上遇到了性骚扰。

sentences.english: Playing music so loudly that it annoys neighbours is antisocial.
sentences.chinese: 大声放音乐骚扰四邻是破坏社会安宁。

sentences.english: As Soviets you should skip Twinblades for harassment and instead go for Kirovs.
sentences.chinese: 作为苏军，你应该跳过双刃骚扰的步骤转而造基洛夫。

sentences.english: Nowadays, the phenomenon of telephone harassment is becoming more and more pervasive.
sentences.chinese: 当前骚扰电话问题日益普遍。

sentences.english: He realized early that the best strategy was to harass the British.
sentences.chinese: 他很早就认识到，最好的战略就是骚扰英国人。

sentences.english: Recently , telephone harassment, it does not.
sentences.chinese: 最近骚扰电话是没有了。

sentences.english: She was a typical victim of harassments, libel and sex abuse .
sentences.chinese: 她是这个折磨，诽谤和性骚扰的一个典型的受害者。

sentences.english: In other words: one must not inconsiderately pester the cause of desire.
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，我们一定不要冒失地骚扰这个欲望的原因。

sentences.english: A dog that molests sheep has to be killed.
sentences.chinese: 必须杀死骚扰羊群的狗。

sentences.english: First, I will not tolerate harassment or any other form of misconduct.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我不能容忍骚扰或任何其它形式的不正当行为。

sentences.english: We were often vexed by bedbugs.
His partner, reportedly hounded by the police, attempted self-immolation.
sentences.chinese: 他的恋人，据说因受到警方的骚扰，曾企图自焚。

sentences.english: Soon, she was being harassed not just online, but in real life.
sentences.chinese: 很快，她不仅在网上受到骚扰，现实生活中也一样。

sentences.english: The victim can be any gender. The harasser can be any gender.
sentences.chinese: 性骚扰者和受害人并非仅限于某单一性别。

sentences.english: They were responding to a disturbance call.
sentences.chinese: 他们当时正在应答一个骚扰电话。

definition: to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to coerce (sb into doing sth bad)/to lure (into a trap)/to seduce
to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
